com.mygdx.hanto.implementation.common

Class HantoRuleSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mygdx.hanto.implementation.common.HantoRuleSet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RuleSetDevelopment

    public abstract class HantoRuleSet
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the rule set for all the hanto games. All the rule set for specific hanto game should implements this interface.
    Version:
    Feb 3, 2013
    Author:
    Peng Ren

      • performPreMoveChecks

        public void performPreMoveChecks(HantoPieceType pieceType,
                                 Coordinate from,
                                 Coordinate to)
                          throws HantoException
        Perform any checks that should be made before actually making the move.
        Parameters:
        pieceType - the hanto game piece
        from - the coordinate where to put piece
        to - the coordinate to put the piece
        Throws:
        HantoException - if any problems are identified

      • doMakeTheMove

        public void doMakeTheMove(HantoPieceType pieceType,
                          Coordinate from,
                          Coordinate to)
        This is the helper function that makes the move for the player.
        Parameters:
        pieceType - the type of piece making the move
        from - the source of the move (null -> placing the piece)
        to - the move target hex

        public MoveResult determineMoveResult()
        This is a helper function to determine the move result after the player made a movement.
        Returns:
        the result of the move

                            throws HantoException

      • ensurePieceIsValid

        protected void ensurePieceIsValid(HantoPieceType pieceType)
                           throws HantoException
        Make sure that the piece that's being moved is actually part of the game.
        Parameters:
        pieceType - the type of the piece that's moving
        Throws:

      • ensurePieceIsAvailable

        protected void ensurePieceIsAvailable(HantoPieceType pieceType,
                                      Coordinate from)
                               throws HantoException
        If the piece is being placed, make sure that there is, in fact, a piece of that type off the board for the player.
        Parameters:
        pieceType - the piece type to be moved
        from - The coordinate from the piece from
        Throws:
        HantoException

      • checkValidDestination

        protected void checkValidDestination(Coordinate to)
                              throws HantoException
        If this is the first move, make sure it's at (0, 0), otherwise it must be adjacent to a piece. For this version, the destination must be empty.
        Parameters:
        to - the destination coordinate
        Throws:
        HantoException

      • checkMoveIsLegal

        protected void checkMoveIsLegal(HantoPieceType pieceType,
                                Coordinate from,
                                Coordinate to)
                         throws HantoException
        If this is a move, rather than placing a piece, it can only be the butterfly and it can only be one square. Otherwise, the move must be placing a piece.
        Parameters:
        pieceType - type of the piece being moved
        from - source hex
        to - destination hex
        Throws:
        HantoException

      • isButterFlyOnBoard

        protected boolean isButterFlyOnBoard()
        This helper function is used to tell if the butterfly of the player of current turn is already put on gameState.getBoard().
        Returns:
        true if the current turn player already put butterfly on gameState.getBoard()

      • addPiecePlacedNum

        protected void addPiecePlacedNum(HantoPlayerColor player,
                                 HantoPieceType piece)
        This is the helper function to keep track the players' butterfly and the sparrows on board.
        Parameters:
        player - the player playing the game
        piece - the piece to be placed

      • switchTurn

        protected void switchTurn()
        Helper function to switch the player at the beginning of the turn and this function also add the turn number at the end of each turn.
